intro: Axinaea integrifolia, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and has lance-shaped leaves with smooth margins. Its flowers bloom in late summer and are pollinated primarily by insects. Axinaea integrifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
